definition: in confusion or disorder/in a confused state of mind/disorder/upheaval/riot/illicit sexual relations/to throw into disorder/to mix up/indiscriminate/random/arbitrary

sentences.english: The active area on the right churns with magnetic loops.
sentences.chinese: 右側活動區域被磁環攪亂。

sentences.english: They shuffled the pieces on the floor and then dropped them into the shoe.
sentences.chinese: 大家把紙條放在地下攪亂，然後裝進了鞋子裏。

sentences.english: So I and my husband has been totally disrupted .
sentences.chinese: 所以我和老公的新完全被攪亂了。

sentences.english: The bad news disrupted our conference.
sentences.chinese: 這則壞消息攪亂了我們的會議。

sentences.english: Your foolishness is playing ducks and drakes with our plans.
sentences.chinese: 你的愚蠢行爲把我們的計劃全攪亂了。

sentences.english: Her face haunts my dreams like the rain at night.
sentences.chinese: 她的臉，如夜雨似的，攪亂我的夢魂。

sentences.english: That is, it jumbles up it's program code to make it difficult to detect.
sentences.chinese: 這意味着它把攪亂它程序代碼，從而使它難以被發現。

sentences.english: Hatred confuses life; love harmonizes it. Hatred darkens life;
sentences.chinese: 仇恨把生活攪亂，愛將其協調。

sentences.english: What puts a spanner into this adjustment mechanism is the rise in global inflation.
sentences.chinese: 進一步攪亂這種調整機制的是全球通脹率的上升。

sentences.english: Don't try to becloud the basic issues.
sentences.chinese: 別企圖把基本問題攪亂了。

sentences.english: The endangered ranger's estrangement deranged my long-range plan.
sentences.chinese: 遭受危險的看林人的離間攪亂了我的長期計劃。

sentences.english: He'll smooth or mess up his hair.
sentences.chinese: 他或許會將頭髮梳齊，也可能將其攪亂。

sentences.english: The sudden children suddenly disturbed Song Di of quiet life.
sentences.chinese: 這突如其來的孩子一下子就攪亂了宋迪之平靜的生活。

sentences.english: There won't be any Arizona Cardinal-type run to ruin Stern's party.
sentences.chinese: 斯特恩不允許再有紅衣主教那樣的人攪亂他的派對。

definition: to incite trouble/to stir up havoc
to spin a cocoon around oneself (idiom); enmeshed in a trap of one's own devising/hoist by his own petard
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to lose one's standing/to have one's reputation swept away/a complete defeat and fall from grace
to fight openly and maneuver covertly (idiom)
to have a clear view of things/to adapt to circumstances
to oppress/to rule as a despot/to tyrannize
to counter every move/to be full of tricks
to plot and kill sb for his property (idiom); to murder for money
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
variant of 幫凶|帮凶[bang1 xiong1]
to force someone to do something
tone sandhi/modified tone/(music) to change key/modulation
